sentences.en: a drama enacted on a darkened stage
sentences.cn: 在灯光暗淡的舞台上演的戏剧

sentences.en: Carbon - based molecules needed protection and assistance to enact this drama.
sentences.cn: 为使生命戏码顺利上演,就必须保护含碳分子,并给予协助.

sentences.en: Congress refused to enact the bill.
I will do no more to enact the peculiarities of life.
sentences.cn: 我不会再去表演生活中的奇特之处.

sentences.en: It is not the right time to enact permanent reforms.
sentences.cn: 目前不是实施长远变革的恰当时机.

sentences.en: It is time to stop arguing tax - rate reductions and to enact them.
sentences.cn: 现在该是停止关于减少税率的争辩,而是把它们付诸实施的时候了.

sentences.en: Life is a drama. Enact it.
sentences.cn: 人生是戏剧, 上演吧.

sentences.en: Members of the English Civil War Society will re-enact the battle.
sentences.cn: 英格兰内战协会的成员将再次展现那场战争。

sentences.en: States are free to enact stricter regulations.
sentences.cn: 各州可自由制定更严格的规则.

sentences.en: The authorities have failed so far to enact a law allowing unrestricted emigration.
sentences.cn: 当局到目前为止还未能通过一项允许自由移民出境的法律。

sentences.en: The king could not enact laws without the sanction of Parliament.
sentences.cn: 未经议会批准，国王不能制定法律。

sentences.en: They're trying to enact a " nationality " bill.
sentences.cn: 他们正试图通过一项 “ 国籍 ” 法案.

sentences.en: To enact ( a feat or role ) before an audience.
sentences.cn: 表演在观众面前表演 ( 一项技艺或角色 )

sentences.en: To enact ( a law or regulation ).
sentences.cn: 制定制订颁布 ( 法律或规章 )

sentences.en: To enact and amend the constitution of the department.
To order by virtue of superior authority ; decree or enact.
sentences.cn: 命令以至高的权威身份来下命令;命令或指定(法令 )

sentences.en: We offer this information to enact positive change, rather than as blatant criticism.
sentences.cn: 我们提供这些信息是为了帮你做出正面的改变, 而不是指责.

sentences.en: You are required to fulfill these obligation as by law enact.
sentences.cn: 你必须履行法律规定的这些义务.

trans.tran_en: to act in a play, story etc
to make a proposal into a law
